result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawnya M Goetz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
-Transcript of Hearing on 09-16-14  - Original filed in 14CF76
- Transcript of Plea Hearing on 09-23-14  - Original filed in 14CF76
- Transcript of Hearing on 12-19-14  - Original filed in 14CF76

ADDRESS INFO for Shawnya M Goetz
Current: 207 Washington, Waunakee, WI 53597 United States  (Effective: 09-23-2014)
Prior: 705 W. Conant St, Portage, WI 53901

Defendant Shawnya M Goetz in court with attorney Anne Renc. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF76, 14CF143, 14CF144

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Court questions if the defendant has served 111 days in jail already. 
Atty Renc indicates defendant has other pending charges which will keep her in custody in Marathon County.  Makes additional statements to the Court.  They are prepared to go to sentencing today.  Defendant is on a signature bond for these cases.  

Defendant enters a plea to 14CF76 Counts 1, 3 and 5 -  NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF76 Counts 1, 3 & 5.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Dismissed and Read-in are the following:  14CF143, 14CF144, 14CF76 Counts 2 & 4. 
Court orders a PSI. 
Court notes there are cash bonds in all files. 

Atty Renc notes there was a motion to modify to signature bonds, questions if the hearing took place. 
Court reviews the file.  The $2,500 cash bond was amended to a $2,500 signature bond in 14CF76. In 14CF143 & 14CF144 were modified to $1,000 signature bonds. 

BY THE COURT: 
PSI to be completed by 12/3/14 with copies forwarded to counsel to prepare for sentencing arguments. 
Bond and conditions of bond are continued.
Plea hearing on September 23, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Sean Drury in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF76, 14CF143, 14CF144

Atty Drury indicates the defendant is in Lincoln County jail on a Marathon County cash bail. 

State will prepare the Writ.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 23, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Shawnya M Goetz in court with attorney Sean P Drury. Defendant Shawnya M Goetz in CUSTODY. Veronica F Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 14CF76, 14CF143 and 14CF144.

1:58 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Isherwood states the appearances.
Set for Motion to Modify Bond filed by Atty Drury.
Atty Drury makes statements regarding the Bond Modification.
Atty Drury states that a Plea Agreement has been reached.
2:03 p.m.  Atty Isherwood indicates that the State does not oppose the bond modification.
Atty Drury stipulates with Atty Isherwood on conditions recommended for bond modification.

BY THE COURT:
14CF76 - 
Bond modified from cash bond of $2500 to signature bond of $2500
Conditions continued
No contact with any Walmart or co-defendants.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
Report to Day Report drug/alcohol free on all Court dates.

14CF143 -
$100 cash bond modified to $1000 signature bond 
Same conditions as 14CF76

14CF144 -
$100 cash bond modified to $1000 signature bond
Same conditions as 14CF76 and 14CF143.

No contact with any Walmart or co-defendants
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription
Report to Day Report drug/alcohol free on all Court dates 
***AMENDED FROM CASH BOND OF $100 TO SIGNATURE BOND OF $1,000
Plea hearing on September 16, 2014 at 10:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 28, 2014 at 10:00 am.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

Not Guilty Plea entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Shawnya M Goetz in court with attorney Sean P Drury. Veronica F Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14CF143, 14CF144

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 21, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
BTC: $100 cash bond on each file:  No contact or be on the premises of Walmart in Plover, WI.

Defendant Shawnya M Goetz appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Veronica F Isherwood appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney  Sean P Drury in court for Defendant Shawnya M Goetz.  Cases 14CF143 and 14CF144.
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
State requests $100 cash bond on each file:  No contact with Walmart in Plover, WI.
BTC: $100 cash bond on each file:  No contact or be on the premises of Walmart in Plover, WI.
